entry.title: New release for Usertour: V0.1.2
entry.content:
ğŸš€ Easy Onboarding: Build Flows Fast with Simple Integration and Smart Targeting

ğŸŒ Compatible with all frameworks: If your app runs in a browser, it seamlessly integrates with Usertour. ğŸ“„ Supports multi-page apps: Whether it's a single-page application or spans across multiple pages, Usertour fits perfectly. ğŸ¯ Advanced user targeting: Define custom user attributes and track events to segment and engage your audience effectively.

ğŸš€ Built for professional workflows with version control and environments

ğŸ› ï¸ Multiple environments supported: Manage environments like Production and Staging within a single Usertour account. ğŸ”„ Version tracking: Monitor every change in your flows, including who made adjustments and when.

ğŸš€ Fully customizable appearance

ğŸ¨ Tailor your design: Adjust text, button colors, font family, and size to match your branding. ğŸ–Œï¸ Support for multiple themes: Create unique themes for different flows, offering flexibility for varied use cases.

ğŸš€ Gain actionable insights with powerful analytics

ğŸ“Š Performance metrics: Track the effectiveness of your flows with detailed data on views and completion rates. ğŸš¨ Identify problem areas: Pinpoint steps causing user confusion or drop-offs and address the issues seamlessly.

entry.title: New release for Usertour: V0.1.3
entry.content:
ğŸ Bug fix

Fix the issue of email sending failure during signup Fix the self-hosting link in the README is incorrect Fix Property 'ENV' does not exist on type 'WindowWithUsertour & typeof globalThis'

5 #9

entry.title: New release for Usertour: V0.1.4
entry.content:
ğŸ’¡ Major Updates - Integrated Biome and Husky for enhanced code quality management - SDK version upgraded to 0.0.5 - Added placement documentation accessibility in Flow Builder

ğŸ”” Breaking Changes - Migrated from ESLint/Prettier to Biome for code formatting and linting - Updated all codebase to comply with Biome standards

ğŸ„ Enhancements - Added direct documentation link for placement configuration in Flow Builder UI - Enhanced development workflow with Husky git hooks - Improved code consistency across the project with Biome integration

ğŸ Bug Fixes - Resolved formatting inconsistencies through Biome implementation - Fixed code style issues across the codebase

entry.title: New release for Usertour: v0.1.5
entry.content:
ğŸ’¡ Major Updates - Implemented dynamic authentication provider rendering - Added environment variables for authentication and file storage - Supported Google login authentication

ğŸ”” Breaking Changes - Removed unnecessary logging in JWT strategy - Migrated to a new environment configuration for API routing and authentication

ğŸ„ Enhancements - Enhanced user creation and project initialization during OAuth login - Added GraphQL query to retrieve authentication provider configuration - Integrated logging for GraphQL errors and JWT token extraction

ğŸ Bug Fixes - Fixed issue where login was not executed after creating a user in the server

entry.title: New release for Usertour: v0.1.6
entry.content:
ğŸ’¡ Major Updates - Added redirect URL support for signup and login flows by @winter100004 in #15 - Introduced member-related features by @winter100004 in #24

ğŸ”” Breaking Changes - Refactored error handling mechanisms by @winter100004 in #21

ğŸ„ Enhancements - Improved word wrapping functionality by @winter100004 in #23

ğŸ Bug Fixes - Fixed issue where login configuration could not be obtained for Email, Google, etc. by @winter100004 in #17 - Updated README documentation by @dongfengtaoadmin in #18 - Updated docker-compose command in README by @winter100004 in #20

ğŸ‘ Special Thanks - @dongfengtaoadmin made their first contribution in #18

ğŸ”” Full Changelog - v0.1.5...v0.1.6
